citation.article-title: Streptomyces pharetrae sp. nov., isolated from soil from the semi-arid Karoo region

p.s: Description of Streptomyces pharetrae sp. nov.
Streptomyces pharetrae (pha.re’trae L. [Gr.] fem. n. pharetra meaning quiver [container for arrows], isolated from soil taken from the base of a Giant quiver tree [Aloe pillansii]).
Strain CZA14T is an aerobic, Gram-positive actinomycete which forms green aerial mycelium and yellow-blue substrate mycelium on ISP4 (inorganic salts–starch agar).
The colour of the substrate mycelium is not pH sensitive.
No fragmentation occurs and no verticils are present.
Mature spore chains are of the Spirales-type with hairy spore ornamentation.
Spores are non-motile.
Good growth is observed on Czapek Solution agar, yeast extract malt extract agar (ISP2) and inorganic salts–starch agar (ISP4).
Substrate mycelium colour is medium-dependent, but aerial mycelium colour is constant.
No diffusible pigment is produced on glycerol–asparagine agar (ISP5).
Melanin is produced on peptone–yeast extract–iron agar (ISP6), but not on tyrosine agar (ISP7).

Weak antibiosis is exhibited against Bacillus coagulans ATCC 7050T, Mycobacterium aurum A+ and Acinetobacter calcoaceticus C91, but there is no antibiosis against Escherichia coli ATCC 25922, Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 and Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923.
Strain CZA14T grows in the presence of 0.3% 2-phenylethanol, 0.0001% crystal violet, 7% NaCl (but not 10%) and 0.1% phenol, but not in the presence of sodium azide (0.01%).

Growth was also observed in the presence of cephaloridine (100 μg/ml), lincomycin (100 μg/ml), penicillin G (10 IU/ml) and rifampicin (50 μg/ml), but not in the presence of neomycin (50 μg/ml) and streptomycin (100 μg/ml).
Growth was observed at 30, 37 and 45 °C, but not at 4 °C or at pH 4.3.

CZA14T uses β-alanine, dl-alanine, ammonium phosphate, l-arginine, l-asparagine, l-cysteine, l-glutamic acid, l-glutamine, l-histidine, l-hydroxyproline, l-isoleucine, l-leucine, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine, potassium nitrate, l-proline, l-serine, urea and l-valine, but not dl-α-amino-n-butyric acid as sole nitrogen sources.

It uses dextran, d(−) fructose, d(+) glucose, α-methyl-d-glucoside, glycerol, glycogen, d(−) ribose, sodium butyrate and sodium sorbate as sole carbon sources, but not adonitol, meso-erythritol, meso-inositol, inulin, maltose, d(+) melibiose, d(+) melezitose, raffinose, salicin, sodium benzoate, sodium formate, sodium lactate, sodium maleate, sodium oxalate, sodium salicylate, sodium l(+) tartrate, trehalose or xylitol.

Weak growth was observed after 21 days on l(+) arabinose, d(−) lactose, d(−) mannitol, d(+) mannose, l(+) rhamnose, sodium acetate, sodium citrate, sodium gluconate, sodium dl-malate, sodium succinate, sucrose and d(+) xylose.
H2S production occurs and nitrate is reduced (weak reaction after 14 days).
Lecithinase, protease and lipase activities are observed on egg-yolk agar.
Pectin is hydrolysed, but not hippurate.
Strain CZA14T degrades adenine, aesculin, arbutin, casein, cellulose, gelatine, hypoxanthine, l-tyrosine, Tween 80 and urea.
Starch hydrolysis is negative at 7 days, but weakly positive when tested at 14 days and 21 days.
Allantoin, guanine, xanthine and xylan are not degraded.
The DNA G+C content is 76.0 (±1.4)%.
The type strain is CZA14T (=DSM 41856T=NRRL B-24333T).
